com.jmex.physics
Class JointAxis

java.lang.Object
  com.jmex.physics.JointAxis
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.jme.util.export.Savable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RotationalJointAxis, TranslationalJointAxis
public abstract class JointAxis
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.jme.util.export.Savable

An axis for a Joint. An axis can belong to only one Joint. Each axis adds one degree of freedom to a joint.

Author:
Irrisor
See Also:
Joint, Joint.createRotationalAxis(), Joint.createTranslationalAxis()

Method Detail

getJoint

public Joint getJoint()

isTranslationalAxis

public abstract boolean isTranslationalAxis()
Returns:
true if this axis imposes translational freedom in the axis direction.

isRotationalAxis

public abstract boolean isRotationalAxis()
Returns:
true if this axis imposes rotational freedom around the axis direction.

setDirection

public void setDirection(com.jme.math.Vector3f direction)
Sets the direction of this axis.

Parameters:
direction - new direction in world coordinate space if the joint is attached to the world, object coordinate space if attached to two objects
See Also:
isRelativeToSecondObject()

getDirection

public com.jme.math.Vector3f getDirection(com.jme.math.Vector3f store)
Query the direction of this axis. The passed in Vector3f will be populated with the values, and then returned.

Parameters:
store - where to store the direction (null to create a new vector)
Returns:
store

getPosition

public abstract float getPosition()
Query position of the objects attached to this joint. For a translational axis this is in direction of this axis, for a rotational axis this is around the axis direction in radians.

Returns:
the relative position of the objects attached to the joint

getVelocity

public abstract float getVelocity()
Returns:
the relative velocity (translation/angular speed) of the objects attached to the joint in/around direction of this axis

setAvailableAcceleration

public abstract void setAvailableAcceleration(float value)
Change the force the joint motor can use to reach the desired velocity.

Parameters:
value - new acceleration than can be used
See Also:
setDesiredVelocity(float)

getAvailableAcceleration

public abstract float getAvailableAcceleration()
Returns:
the maximum force available to reach the desired velocity
See Also:
setAvailableAcceleration(float)

setDesiredVelocity

public abstract void setDesiredVelocity(float value)
Change the desired velocity. The joint motor uses the available linear acceleration to reach the specified velocity as fast as possible.

Parameters:
value - new desired linear velocity
See Also:
setAvailableAcceleration(float)

getDesiredVelocity

public abstract float getDesiredVelocity()
Returns:
the last set desired velocity
See Also:
setDesiredVelocity(float)

setPositionMinimum

public abstract void setPositionMinimum(float value)
Change the smallest allowed position.

Parameters:
value - smallest allowed position, Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY to disable minimum

getPositionMinimum

public abstract float getPositionMinimum()
Returns:
smallest allowed position, Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY if minimum is disabled

setPositionMaximum

public abstract void setPositionMaximum(float value)
Change the largest allowed position.

Parameters:
value - largest allowed position, Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY to disable maximum

getPositionMaximum

public abstract float getPositionMaximum()
Returns:
largest allowed position, Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY if maximum is disabled

copy

public void copy(JointAxis toCopy)
Copy axis data from another axis.

Parameters:
toCopy - where to read values from

isRelativeToSecondObject

public boolean isRelativeToSecondObject()
getter for field relativeToSecondObject

Returns:
true if this axis' direction is given in coordinates relative to the second object. The default is false which means it is relative to the first object (resp. the world)

setRelativeToSecondObject

public void setRelativeToSecondObject(boolean value)
setter for field relativeToSecondObject

Parameters:
value - new value
